messages.message:
I've noticed that the source tracking feature that scrolls to where in the document the extraction was conducted is very temperamental. I've recorded a Loom (https://www.loom.com/share/736a8590b2744026af2792cfa22a698f?sid=81705656-4ecb-49a9-9304-926459789250) that shows this variability in behaviour - refreshing the project 3 times results in 3 different sets of behaviour. When the feature works properly, repeatedly clicking different fields seems to break it.

FYI, I love this feature, it's incredibly useful for demos when its working :grinning:
This is in prod. Project here (https://aihub.instabase.com/hub/build/751856fd-354f-45a1-a2f0-b708595531ef). Doc used attached here
for long docs, sometimes we don’t scroll to the right position (see similar previously reported issue (https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C0516UPPMT3/p1701334036828319)) :disappointed:

btw i noticed in your loom that sometimes the doc viewer doesn’t scroll because it’s already on the page containing the field value

ex: if the field value is on page 1 and you’re already on page 1, the doc viewer won’t scroll to the field value, even if it’s currently not in view bc of the zoom level

i think that most of the inconsistency here is caused by the table entities on this document

there was a bug where we’d always scroll to the first table entity, instead of the field value

this bug is fixed by https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/54224, which will be included in 24.08

fyi @Aayush
Yes this change ^ should resolve this - it filters the table annotations from the provenance scroll handler.
